Generation IV.Diamond: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Generation IV.Pearl: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Generation IV.Platinum: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

Generation V.Black: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
Generation V.White: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
Generation V.Black 2: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.
Generation V.White 2: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.

Generation VI.X: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Generation VI.Y: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, Gliscor swoops!
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, Gliscor swoops!
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.

Generation IX.Scarlet: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
Generation IX.Violet: It flies soundlessly through the sky. It catches prey with its long tail, then lunges at the prey's vulnerable spots with its fangs.

Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Coronet Highlands : near Primeval Grotto , massive mass outbreaks

method: Level up (holding Razor Fang, during the night)
